multilevelcoda 0.0.9000

    Multilevel Models with Compositional Predictors
  • Changelog

Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multilevel compositional model via full Bayesian inference using brms,

Source: R/brmcoda.R
brmcoda.Rd

This function fits a brm model with multilevel ILR coordinates.

Usage

brmcoda(formula, compilr, ...)

Arguments

formula

A object of class formula, brmsformula: A symbolic description of the model to be fitted. Details of the model specification can be found in brmsformula.

compilr

A compilr object containing data of composition, ILR coordinates, and other variables used in the model.

...

Further arguments passed to brm.

Value

A list with two elements

  • CompIlr An object of class compilr used in the brm model.

  • Model An object of class brmsfit, which contains the posterior draws along with many other useful information about the model.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
data(mcompd)
data(sbp)
cilr <- compilr(data = mcompd, sbp = sbp, parts = c("TST", "WAKE", "MVPA", "LPA", "SB"), idvar = "ID")

# inspects ILRs before passing to brmcoda
names(cilr$BetweenILR)
names(cilr$WithinILR)
names(cilr$TotalILR)

# model with compositional predictor at between and within-person levels
m1 <- brmcoda(compilr = cilr, 
             formula = STRESS ~ bilr1 + bilr2 + bilr3 + bilr4 + wilr1 + wilr2 + wilr3 + wilr4 + (1 | ID), 
             chain = 1, iter = 500)

# model with compositional outcome  
m2 <- brmcoda(compilr = cilr, 
              formula = mvbind(ilr1, ilr2, ilr3, ilr4) ~ STRESS + Female + (1 | ID),
             chain = 1, iter = 500) 
               
}
